Sentencas: In this paper, we study a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) controlled by a multi-input multi-output (MIMO) compensator, which uses the blower/fan power and cathode inlet temperature as actuators.
Titulo: Enhanced Power Generation in SOFCs Using Artificial Limits on Actuator Control Signals

Sentencas: The usable power of the fuel cell (FC) is maximized by limiting the air flow rate deliberately when an increase in power is demanded.
Titulo: Enhanced Power Generation in SOFCs Using Artificial Limits on Actuator Control Signals

Sentencas: Possible rate bounds on the cathode inlet temperature are also modeled.
Titulo: Enhanced Power Generation in SOFCs Using Artificial Limits on Actuator Control Signals

Sentencas: These bounds could represent the physical limitations (due to slow dynamics of heat exchangers) and/or a control concept for accommodating the power saving objective.
Titulo: Enhanced Power Generation in SOFCs Using Artificial Limits on Actuator Control Signals

Sentencas: Applying proper limits to the amplitude and rate of the actuator signals, and incorporating antiwindup (AW) techniques, can raise the net power of the FC by 16% with negligible effects on the spatial temperature profile.
Titulo: Enhanced Power Generation in SOFCs Using Artificial Limits on Actuator Control Signals
